Class MapPanel

  • java.lang.Object

      • java.awt.Container

  • All Implemented Interfaces:

    public class MapPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Visualizes the Map.
    Author:
    S.A.M. Janssen
    See Also:

      • MapPanel

    • Method Detail

      • addMapComponent

        public void addMapComponent(MapComponent component)
        Adds a MapComponent to the map. It is assumed that a MapComponent has a MapComponentView that visualizes the MapComponent. The naming convention for a MapComponentView is: "MapComponentName"+"View". For instance, the MapComponent HumanAgent has a MapComponentView called HumanAgentView.
        Parameters:
        component - The component.

      • addMapComponent

        private void addMapComponent(MapComponent component,
                             int superClasses)
        Adds a MapComponent to the map. It is a recursive method that at takes a component and a value as an input. The value represents the number of super classes above the component we want to add a visualization of. This is used, because some map components do not have a specific visualization. For instance, the Passenger does not have a view corresponding to it, but the HumanAgent (the superclass of Passenger) does have a corresponding view.
        Parameters:
        component - The component.
        superClasses - The number of super classes above.

      • addMapComponentView

        public void addMapComponentView(java.lang.Class<? extends MapComponentView> view)
        Adds a map component view.
        Parameters:
        view - The view.

      • clicked

        public void clicked(int x,
                    int y)
        Method called when the user clicks the mouse. It is used to show about boxes for map components.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate.
        y - The y coordinate.

      • doZoomRectangle

        public void doZoomRectangle(int xStart,
                            int yStart,
                            int xEnd,
                            int yEnd)
        Indicates the coordinates that are needed for the zoom in rectangle.
        Parameters:
        xStart - Top left x coordinate.
        yStart - Top left y coordinate.
        xEnd - Bottom right x coordinate.
        yEnd - Bottom right y coordinate.

      • zoom

        public void zoom(int xStart,
                 int yStart,
                 int xEnd,
                 int yEnd,
                 double mapX)
        Calculates the parameters needed for the user specified zoom. It ensures that the users specified ratio is respected, while making sure that the maximum dimensions are used.
        Parameters:
        xStart - Top left x coordinate.
        yStart - Top left y coordinate.
        xEnd - Bottom right x coordinate.
        yEnd - Bottom right y coordinate.
        mapX - The width of the map.
